intro: Alternanthera littoralis var. maritima, commonly known as salt marsh alternate, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Americas. It is a perennial herb that thrives in brackish or saline wetlands, often found in marshes and estuaries. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves that are typically red or purple in color, which help in photosynthesis under low-light conditions. It produces small, inconspicuous greenish flowers that are clustered in spikes. This species plays an important role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
